title: Understanding Retinal Image Segmentation Techniques for Glaucoma Diagnosis

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental medical imaging analysis and basic machine learning concepts
context.additional_context: Technical training program for employees of glaucoma diagnostic medical device/software development companies, focusing on improving workplace efficiency for specialized professionals

learning_goals: They can explain the clinical significance of retinal image segmentation in glaucoma diagnosis.
They can compare traditional and deep learning-based image segmentation techniques for Optic Cup/Disc (OC/OD) analysis.
They can evaluate clinical applications of deep learning models such as U-Net and Mask R-CNN.
They can interpret performance metrics (accuracy, processing speed, etc.) of image segmentation algorithms in alignment with operational environments.

resources: Deep Learning Model Architecture Comparison Materials

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
